title: Common: viewpro driver links for 4.4 and 4.5
body:
This corrects the links that users should use for the ViewPro gimbal driver lua script.  This is in response to [this beta testing discussion where a user couldn't get the gimbal working](https://discuss.ardupilot.org/t/viewpro-gimbal-setting-help/100173).

This has been tested locally and looks ok.

title: Copter: command list correction for Loiter Turns direction
body:
This corrects the Copter mission command list to remove the Dir field which isn't actually supported.

This is in response to [this discussion](https://discuss.ardupilot.org/t/loiter-turns-in-missions-clockwise-only/85690/3)

I have tested this locally and it looks OK.

title: Copter: fixup wind speed est param range
body:
This fixes up the copter wind speed estimation's page's statement re the expected range of the EK3_DRAG_MCOEF parameter.  I had incorrectly said it was 1 to 2 but in fact it is 0.1 to 1.0 which [matches the parameter description](https://github.com/ArduPilot/ardupilot/blob/master/libraries/AP_NavEKF3/AP_NavEKF3.cpp#L693) and also my findings from actually flight tests.

I have not actually tested this change on my local PC but surely it's fine.

title: GPIO page incorrectly states SERVOn_FUNCTION = 0 will output TRIM
body: The [GPIO page](https://ardupilot.org/copter/docs/common-gpios.html) says, "If set to “0”, it remains a PWM output, unassigned to a function, and outputs that output’s trim value when board safety is not active" but as discussed at the last dev call, there will actually be no PWM output until a do-set-servo or lua script sets the PWM

title: Common: fix links on or to dshot and BLHeli pages
body:
This PR fixes a number of broken links that appeared with the recent update to the DShot and BLHeli pages.

- Fixed small typo affecting a link on the new dshot wiki page.
- Fixed various links to ESC telemetry.  One page had two links, one to the DShot page and another to the BLHeli page.. these have now been combined together so I removed one of the links.  It's possible that we could have instead provided a link to the Bi-directional dshot section that can also provide RPM but without the need for a separate telemetry wire.

This has been tested on my local PC.

title: Update Sphinxsetup.sh
body: Fix python3 and docker and CI

title: Bootloader docs link to a 404 on github
body: https://ardupilot.org/dev/docs/bootloader.html has a link to `README.txt` (points at https://github.com/ArduPilot/ardupilot/blob/master/Tools/bootloaders/README.txt ) which is 404 on github. I'm pretty sure this should be swapped to be `README.md` at this point.

title: clicking on CUAV V5 image leads to 404 error
body:
Clicking on the top image on the CUAV V5 plus board produces a Not Found error
http://ardupilot.org/copter/docs/common-cuav-v5plus-overview.html

title: Motor Order issue for OctaQuad Plus
body:
The motor order diagram for [OctaQuad Plus](http://ardupilot.org/copter/docs/connect-escs-and-motors.html#octoquad) is incorrect ([direct link](http://ardupilot.org/copter/_images/motororder-octoquad-plus-2d.png)).  Motors 6 and 8 are swapped.

This is a list of what's currently shown and what it should be:

Now, ShouldBe
1 -- OK
8 -- should be 6
4 -- OK
7 -- OK
3 -- OK
6 -- should be 8
2 -- OK
5 -- OK

title: Document waypoint 0
body: Currently we make no mention of waypoint 0 beeing the home. We should document that

title: SITL Simulator (Software in the Loop)
body:
[SITL Simulator (Software in the Loop)](http://ardupilot.org/dev/docs/sitl-simulator-software-in-the-loop.html) 
Hi, for the sake of clarity, it should be stated that the physics simulation is now using the SIM_Multicopter.cpp instead SIM_Multicopter.py as illustrated on the figure (I'm using Copter 3.4.6). If I had access to the figure, I could modify it :).

Maybe it's just me being pedantic, but I had a hard time realizing where to modify the physics simulation code for my research.

Cheers!

title: Battery failsafe documentation
body: All the battery failsafe docs for the upcoming releases (Copter 3.6, Plane 3.9) are now stale. There are now independent low and critical actions, priorities between low/critical failsafes, and the failsafes are configured per battery monitor. See https://github.com/ArduPilot/ardupilot/pull/7213 for more details.

body:
Hi,
I am trying to build a px4-v2 target with waf
 and get an error:

I think it is an unresolved issue

Thank you

title: Maxbotic I2C Sonar Rangefinder
body:
[Maxbotic I2C Sonar Rangefinder](http://ardupilot.org/copter/docs/common-rangefinder-maxbotixi2c.html) - Describe the issue/suggestion and improve the title. Please keep a link to the original article if relevant.

I have a problem with this. When I select 4 in RNGFND_TYPE = “4” (PX4-MaxbotixI2C sonar)
 Maxbotix I2C the value I have selected in the configuration Range Finder page disappear. So where is the right place to select the Sensor type? Seems confusing for me.

title: Mission Planner Bluetooth Connectivity: correct wrong imported image from old wiki
body:
Fixes #919 

Apparently the image was imported wrongly from the old wiki. I've tracked down the correct image using Archive.org. Using the same service, I've also tracked down the current image to being used last in May 2014 in the Geotagging page.

title: Using-flaps docs is out of date
body:
In [Automatic Flaps#Using flaps](http://ardupilot.org/plane/docs/automatic-flaps.html#using-flaps):

> To use flaps they must be configured on channel 5, 6, 7 or 8. If you wish to have manual control of the flaps then they must be on 5, 6, or 7.

Is out of date.  Flaps can be on any channel

Lightware SF02 Rangefinder URL wrong
body:

The URL for this product has changed. New URL is here: 
http://www.lightware.co.za/shop/en/drone-altimeters/7-sf02f.html

body: TYPO- Change AMP to APM

title: Long words don't wrap onto multiple lines, and page can not be panned right.
body: Long descriptions like the last word of http://ardupilot.org/plane/docs/parameters.html#log-bitmask-log-bitmask doesn't fit on a single screen width, and the last part of the bit description is not readable.

title: Fix edit on Github link for anchors
body: If  a page url has an anchor - e.g. http://ardupilot.org/copter/docs/connect-escs-and-motors.html#testing-motor-spin-directions then the **Edit on Github** link does not work properly.  This needs to be fixed in the theme.

title: Adding a new MAVLink Message (Code Overview) is outdated
body: [Adding a new MAVLink Message (Code Overview)](http://ardupilot.org/dev/docs/code-overview-adding-a-new-mavlink-message.html) - This page is outdated, we now have a mavlink submodule and generate.sh script doesn't exist anymore.

title: Sounds (Pixhawk/PX4)
body: [Sounds (Pixhawk/PX4)](http://ardupilot.org/plane/docs/common-sounds-pixhawkpx4.html) - Sound files are missing

title: Dangerous advice?
body:
http://ardupilot.org/copter/docs/ac_tipsfornewpilots.html

There was a post recently on diydrones where a novice was trying to build a meter size (T960) hex with 16" CF props.  It was flipping initially and when esc order was sorted it was then leaning significantly when trying to take off.  This wiki page was cited by several people as advice to proceed and what they had done in the past.

```
" Hold the copter firmly in your hand and level in the air and with the props clear of your body, advance the throttle a bit to get a feel for what’s going on. "
```

Is this not potentially incredibly dangerous advice for newbies?  I wouldn't like to think of the potential harm that could come from large CF props if a copter tried to flip while throttle raised above someone's head.  Perhaps I'm just being silly/unreasonable, but thought I would raise it for discussion.

title: Deeper level of TOC nesting on new wiki theme.
body: The current toc is about 4 levels deep. This means that more deeply nested topics do not get a TOC. In particularly thinking about plane parameters.

title: Problem running SITL on Windows (with or without Mavproxy)
body:
I followed precisely instructions on (http://dev.ardupilot.com/wiki/sitl-native-on-windows/) to run Sitil on Windows (Win 7). The installation part goes as documented (Cygwin install, MavProxy install).
It fails though when trying to run it, and it fails in the two possible modes : with or without mavProxy.

1-With MavProxy I run the command line as indicated in the doc and it fails with the following output:

Hugues@Hugues-PC ~/ardupilot/Arducopter
$ sim_vehicle.sh -j4 --map
~/ardupilot/Arducopter ~/ardupilot/Arducopter
Building sitl
Checking modules
// BUILDROOT=/tmp/Arducopter.build HAL_BOARD=HAL_BOARD_SITL HAL_BOARD_SUBTYPE=HAL_BOARD_SUBTYPE_NONE TOOLCHAIN=NATIVE EXTRAFLAGS=-DGIT_VERSION="4bf3ec0e"
~/ardupilot/Arducopter
Starting up at CMAC : -35.363261,149.165230,584,353
Starting ardupilot : /home/Hugues/ardupilot/Arducopter/Arducopter.elf -S -I0 --home -35.363261,149.165230,584,353 --model --speedup=1
Window access not found, logging to /tmp/ardupilot.log
../Tools/autotest/run_in_terminal_window.sh: line 28:  6004 Segmentation fault      (core dumped) $cmd $\* &> $filename < /dev/null

The Mavproxy console and map window are displayed. The MacProxy console indicates the following error message:
Exception in thread main_loop:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\Users\Stephen\Documents\MAVProxy\MAVProxy\build\mavproxy\out00-PYZ.py
....
What is thus user "Stephen" ? Is this something hardcoded somewhere ?

2-Then I tried the second method without MavProxy and it fails too:

Hugues@Hugues-PC ~/ardupilot/Arducopter
$ ./ArduCopter.elf --home -35,149,584,270 --model quad
Started model quad at -35,149,584,270 at speed 1.0
Starting sketch 'Arducopter'
Starting SITL input
bind port 5760 for 0
Serial port 0 on TCP port 5760
Waiting for connection ....
bind port 5762 for 2
Serial port 2 on TCP port 5762
bind port 5763 for 3
Serial port 3 on TCP port 5763
ERROR: Floating point exception - aborting
Aborted (core dumped)

Am I doing something wrong or is this known under windows and how to solve it ?

Thx

title: Communicating with Raspberry Pi via MAVLink
body:
[Communicating with Raspberry Pi via MAVLink](http://dev.ardupilot.com/wiki/raspberry-pi-via-mavlink/) - Couple of comments on the "communicating with raspberry pi" section
1. I'm not sure the +5v connection from the pixhawk to the pi should be made. I'm running without it. Common ground yes, but the +5v is not needed, as the pi has its own power supply thru usb, and the GPIO +5 header is un-regulated, which introduces risk of damaging the pi.
2. the "screen -x" command should be "sudo screen -x". The reason for this is that any commands started inside of rc.local will run as root. Thereby, simply using screen -x will fail, as there are no screen instances running for the current user.

title: Adding a new MAVLink Message (Code Overview) has bugs
body:
[Adding a new MAVLink Message (Code Overview)](http://dev.ardupilot.com/wiki/code-overview-adding-a-new-mavlink-message/) is out of date
1. What is the autogeneration feature?
2. What version does it come in?
3. The docs say
   
   > Step #3: Add the new message definition to the common.xml or ardupilotmega.xml file
   
   But these links are broken.
   
   > Step 4 says you need to call ./libraries/GCS_MAVLink/generate.sh

What is the actual story here? Is it a matter that if you update the master definition in https://github.com/diydrones/mavlink/tree/master/message_definitions and rebuild ardupilot then step 3 and 4 are done for you? In what versions is this true. 

1.Do we need to talk about the "old version

title: Copter Parameters - FS_BATT_ENABLE, FS_BATT_VOLTAGE, FS_BATT_MAH
body:
[Copter Parameters](http://copter.ardupilot.com/wiki/arducopter-parameters/) 

Hi,

I'm not sure part 1.16 of the documentation is clear.

FS_BATT_ENABLE describes the action for battery failsafe, 0=disabled, 1=Lane, 2=RTL.

Then we move onto FS_BATT_VOLTAGE and FS_BATT_MAH, which both suggest that if we fall below these values we "WILL" RTL. Does this "actually" depend on the value of  FS_BATT_ENABLE? i.e. the action would be RTL, LAND or if FS_BATT_ENABLE = 0 would be totally ignored?

I'd appreciate clarification as I have an issue raised against the APM Log File Analyser by a user because based on FS_BATT_ENABLE = 0 I'm stating the FS is not activated.

https://github.com/diydrones/APM_Log_File_Analyzer/issues/233

Thanks
Kev

title: Smart Battery
body: The link to the startup script needs to be updated; batt_smbus starts at line 465 and not 399.

title: Setting up SITL on Linux. Load a mission.
body:
[Setting up SITL on Linux](http://dev.ardupilot.com/wiki/setting-up-sitl-on-linux/)

In section **Load a mission** command

```
wp load ../Tools/autotest/Plane-Missions/CMAC-toff-loop.txt
```

should be changed to 

```
wp load ../Tools/autotest/ArduPlane-Missions/CMAC-toff-loop.txt
```

as there is no **Plane-Missions** directory in autotest.

title: Setting up SITL on Linux. Installing packages
body:
[Setting up SITL on Linux](http://dev.ardupilot.com/wiki/setting-up-sitl-on-linux/#jsbsim_plane_only)

In the section: **JSBSim (Plane only)** stated that _libtool_ should be installed. However, on my Ubuntu 15.10 command 

```
./autogen.sh --enable-libraries
```

 outputs an error 

```
**Error**: You must have `libtool' installed to compile jsbsim.
```

I suspect that package **libtool-bin** should be installed on Ubuntu.

title: 3DR Solo Example to change to Mode1 is incorrect
body:
[3DR Solo (Developer Information)](http://dev.ardupilot.com/wiki/solo/)
Hi,
I just went through the example provided to change the stick mapping to mode1.
The example actually describes the settings for mode4, having throttle and roll on the left stick and pitch and yaw on the right stick. 
The correct mapping for mode 1 should be:
throttle stick-id = 1, dir = 0
roll stick-id = 2, dir = 0
pitch stick-id = 3, dir = 1
yaw stick-id = 0, dir = 0
Thx Stephan

body: [EPM Gripper](http://copter.ardupilot.com/wiki/common-electro-permanent-magnet-gripper/) doc is out of date as of Copter 3.3. Need @rmackay9 help to find out how integration has changed.

title: Building for Bebop on Linux: Recovery Tip
body:
[Building for Bebop on Linux](http://dev.ardupilot.com/wiki/building-for-bebop-on-linux/) - Describe the issue/suggestion and improve the title. Please keep a link to the original article if relevant

Tip for **Recovery**:
If you are getting a read-only file system error while trying to restore your rcS init file, then try running `mount -o remount,rw 'rootfs'` to make your file system writeable.

@jberaud is this reasonable?

title: Building for Bebop on Linux: Change recommended compiler
Don't forget to mention python-dev
body:
In section **Installing and configuring MavProxy** of page http://dev.ardupilot.com/wiki/making-a-mavlink-wifi-bridge-using-the-raspberry-pi/

Necessary modules needed before installing `droneapi` were mentioned. However, without `python-dev`, the following `sudo pip install droneapi` command will fail.

Maybe it was a common sense need not to be mentioned, but I think it can be helpful to those new to Python.

title: Misinformation on common-Maxbotic Analog Sonar – Copter3.2
body:
[common-Maxbotic Analog Sonar – Copter3.2](http://copter.ardupilot.com/wiki/common-rangefinder-maxbotix-analog/) 

This page says to set the meters per volt value to 2.04 because that is 7m (range) / 5v (power supply), only 7/5 is 1.4, not 2.04, so this value looks incorrect.

However, the 2.04 number is correct, because it is derived from the Vcc/1024 volts per cm value in the datasheet for the Matbotix sonar modules. If Vcc = 5, 5/1024 = 0.00488v/cm = 0.488v/m = 2.04m/v

See also #81 - the sonar pages as a whole are confusing and need to be cross-referenced better to understand why there are three separate ones.

title: Simple/Super Simple Mode on Copter
body:
Hi

I was reviewing the code at 
https://github.com/diydrones/ardupilot/blob/master/ArduCopter/switches.cpp#L275

and the code does the following when a CH7/CH12 has SuperSimple Mode enabled:

On a 2 position switch it can be either off or SuperSimple mode enabled.

On a 3 position switch it can be off, middle switch is SIMPLE, high is SUPERSIMPLE.

The following page should be more explicit regarding this http://copter.ardupilot.com/wiki/channel-7-and-8-options/

And this paragraph :
Ch7 or Ch8 can be set-up to enable/disable Simple and Super Simple mode.
If Simple Mode is selected the raising the switch high will enable Simple mode, low will disable it.
If Super Simple mode is selected then raising the switch high will enable Super Simple mode, low will disable it and if a 3-position switch is used the middle position will enable regular simple mode.
Only Ch7 or Ch8 (not both) should be set to either Simple mode or Super Simple mode.
The Ch7/Ch8 switch position will be override the simple/super-simple options selected on the Flight Modes screen.

here:http://copter.ardupilot.com/wiki/simpleandsuper-simple-modes/#use_ch7ch8_to_select_normal_simple_or_super_simple_mode

could be a bit more clear :)

btw: can we rename the CH7/CH8 channels to something else like: OPTIONS CHANNELS ? because now we can go up to CH12 ?

(Maybe XXX is "newflightmode").

[Adding a New Flight Mode (Copter Code Overview)](http://dev.ardupilot.com/wiki/apmcopter-adding-a-new-flight-mode/)

title: Using ROS/Gazebo Simulator with SITL - Installation Instructions Issues/Inconsistencies
body:
Hello,

I am trying to install the ROS/Gazebo Simulator. However I noticed some issues with the instructions provided. These are very minor "issues", but can be improved for beginners or people unfamiliar with ROS to an extent as per me. 

Are all the instructions in "Cloning the necessary ROS packages" required to be executed under catkin_ws/src/ ? Because after cloning rotors_simulator.git you need to checkout sonar_plugin, which can be done only when you are in the rotors_simulator folder. This is followed by the wstool instructions. Are they supposed to be executed under /src/ ?

"wstool update -t src rosdep install --from-paths src --ignore-src --rosdistro indigo -y"

What exactly is --from-paths here? As per http://wiki.ros.org/indigo/Installation/Source#Resolving_Dependencies it's not supposed to be replaced by any actual path and is just another option/flag to set. But it throws an error at me: "no such option: --from-paths"

So what step(s) am I missing here? 

[Using ROS/Gazebo Simulator with SITL](http://dev.ardupilot.com/wiki/using-rosgazebo-simulator-with-sitl/)

title: Communicating with Raspberry Pi via MAVLink
body:
[Communicating with Raspberry Pi via MAVLink](http://dev.ardupilot.com/wiki/raspberry-pi-via-mavlink/) 

In the chapter "Install the required packages on the Raspberry Pi" it would help to mention the installation of additional dependencies;

`sudo apt-get install python-dev`
`sudo apt-get install libxml2-dev`
`sudo apt-get install libxslt-dev`

before next lines can be executed:
`sudo pip install pymavlink`
`sudo pip install mavproxy`

Thanks

title: Switched TELEM ports in Overview
body:
In this overview page: http://plane.ardupilot.com/wiki/common-pixhawk-overview/ the legend says that TELEM1 is for OD and TELEM2 is for radio telemetry.

However, I think this is the other way around, as is also seen in this quick connection page: http://plane.ardupilot.com/wiki/common-pixhawk-wiring-and-quick-start/#pixhawk_wiring_chart and http://plane.ardupilot.com/wiki/common-minim-osd-quick-installation-guide/

Can someone verify? Thanks.

title: TKOFF_TDRAG_SPD1: Conflicting documentation
body:
Parameter documentation reads: "It should also be set to zero for tricycle undercarriages."

However, one parameter above, in `TKOFF_TDRAG_ELEV`we read:
"For most tricycle undercarriage aircraft a value of zero will work well, but for some tricycle aircraft a small negative value (say around -20 to -30) will apply down elevator which will hold the nose wheel firmly on the ground during initial acceleration."
meaning that a non-zero `TKOFF_TDRAG_SPD1` value is needed for `TKOFF_TDRAG_ELEV` to take effect.

Isn't that a conflicting statement?

title: Wiki revisors can't preview their changes
body:
There is no way for normal editors to preview their work:
- The preview button is not visible for wiki revisors (our normal users) when they create the first revision. 
- There is a preview link next to each pending revision in the revisionary "review revisions" screen, but this link only works for admin users. 

The first issue has previously been reported and ignored. There are a number of reported issues around the revisions link not working, but I can't find a complete match on symptoms on an open issue. I have therefore created this: https://wordpress.org/support/topic/revisionary-preview-not-working-maybe-permissions-issue

title: Flightgear simulation topic needs update
body: [How to Set Up Hardware-in-the-Loop Simulation with FlightGear](http://plane.ardupilot.com/wiki/flightgear/) topic needs updating. Have requested support in arduwiki editors group as first step.

title: Update PPM Encoder doc (common)
body:
Thesse both cover the PPM encoder. 
- http://plane.ardupilot.com/wiki/common-ppm-encoder/
- http://plane.ardupilot.com/wiki/encoder-3/

Randy suggests:   
- Merge them with the common-ppm-encoder info being at the top and the encoder-3 stuff being below.  The top part of encoder-3 can be zapped, so just merge across “Setup Manual” and everything below.
- It should probably be added to the Optional Hardware section and there should probably be a link to this page from the “Connecting the radio receiver” pages for APM2 and Pixhawk.  http://copter.ardupilot.com/wiki/connecting-your-rc-input-and-motors/
- Randy says "I really don’t recommend people use the PPM encoder because it apparently introduces lag (at least 5 people have told me so so even though I haven’t seen it I believe them).". Perhaps add as warning

body:
Logout should simply skip this request.

Note that you can log out, but you need to enter the first level credentials.

title: Improve Wordpress wiki load performance
body:
Using google fonts can slow loading as the fetch operation is blocking and the fonts expire immediately. Usually this is not a big problem, but if there are lots of fonts fetched or if google is misbehaving this can significantly impact page rendering (see http://www.webnots.com/fix-slow-page-loading-waiting-fonts-googleapis-com/ ). 

Solution for this problem has been to:
- install https://wordpress.org/plugins/disable-google-fonts/ (removes google fonts from the theme). 
- In the Nextend menu plugin change the font from google Arimo to Arial (the font was not found locally).

title: varnish cache is not being auto-invalidated on page update
body: When we edit a wiki page the new page should be immediately visible to all users. To support that we use a wordpress plugin to tell the varnish cache to invalidate any cached content for that page. That used to work, but stopped working on one of the wordpress updates. We need to diagnose and fix that problem.

title: Add Antenna Tracker to drop-down list under Home
body: This link: http://copter.ardupilot.com/wiki/common-antennatracker-introduction/

title: [site_ArduRover] and friends are not being rendered
body: The conditional shortcodes to only display text in a particular context are not working (these were part of the theme). They need to be added back into the theme.

title: The menus under dev.ardupilot.com need to be re-structured
body: These menu items have grown over time.  They now need to be sorted out as lots of them at the top level should be grouped together under the same level.  Will action this once the new Wiki format comes online.

title: Tidy CLI pages in Dev Wiki
body:
All CLI content was moved to dev wiki as part of #15 . This task is to tidy those remaining documents. 

```
Mission Planner Terminal
    common-CLI Setup Test modes
    common-Mission Planner Command Line Interface (CLI)
    Mission Planner Command Line Interface (CLI)
    Using the Command Line Interface
    Setting up flight modes with the CLI
    Using the Command Line Interface to Configure APM:Copter
```

title: Copter has 2 troubleshooting articles
body:
Merge
- http://copter.ardupilot.com/wiki/troubleshooting-2/ - appears to be more complete.
- http://copter.ardupilot.com/wiki/troubleshooting-guide/ - not been updated for 2 years.

title: Tutorial videos coming up as private (plane)
body:
All but two of these videos are coming up as private on YouTube: http://plane.ardupilot.com/wiki/videoguides/

(originally posted here: http://ardupilot.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=51&t=4704 )

title: APM Instructions - broken link
body:
I'm trying to learn about log files but when I click through on the link "learn more about working with log files" contained within the APM Throttle Mid page in the APM Copter instructions the link is broken. 

Can anyone direct me to where I can find the info, please?

I am struggling to graph data off my apm2.5. I have followed the instructions on the APM Throttle Mid page but there does not appear to be any relevant info in my log file and I cannot graph the data. Trying to find out what I am doing wrong.

(Originally posted http://ardupilot.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=51&t=7307 )

title: Groundstation description not complete
body:
The description of the HUD in http://copter.ardupilot.com/wiki/common-using-a-ground-station/ is not complete, it ends with 11 (which btw. seems to be wrong description), while the numbers go to 15.

(Originally posted here: http://ardupilot.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=51&t=9879 )

title: Randy Copter Fix list
body:
Hamish, All,

On another note, here are  the things that I’d like to fix on the copter wiki.  I know we may not get to these immediately but I wanted to get them written down in any case.
# Formatting changes:

Done: https://github.com/diydrones/ardupilot-wiki-issue-tracker/issues/10#issuecomment-138752261

Done. Split out assembly section instructions to https://github.com/diydrones/ardupilot-wiki-issue-tracker/issues/23#issue-55559802

Done. Split up the configuring hardware section: https://github.com/diydrones/ardupilot-wiki-issue-tracker/issues/10#issuecomment-140257170

Done. Made Pixhawk ahead of APM2 everywhere: https://github.com/diydrones/ardupilot-wiki-issue-tracker/issues/10#issuecomment-140290033
# New/changed contents:

Done/handled elsewhere: Discussion around Planning a Waypoint Mission has been split out to #150

Done/handled elsehwere. Split out "Antenna Tracker needs a set-up video" issue to #149

Done. Parameter reset doc created by Randy: https://github.com/diydrones/ardupilot-wiki-issue-tracker/issues/10#issuecomment-140290162

title: Fix up the 3DR Radio docs
body: The documents for the different radios contain a lot of duplication. The proposal is to split them under a landing page with the 3Dr version 2 and version 1 documents containing only the hardware specific information. The country specific information should also be separated.

title: CHDK has duplicate docs
body: You can see duplicates in search: http://copter.ardupilot.com/?s=chdk&submit=Search

title: Search higlighting doesn't work on Firefox
body:
Search higlighting doesn't work on Firefox - see search:

http://copter.ardupilot.com/?s=zener+diode&submit=Search

Highlighting does work on Chrome.

title: Drag'n'drop addition of media files doesn't work
body:
When adding media files to a wiki page it pops up a screen that says you can drag-and-drop the files or push a button to select the file. I found that I couldn't do the drag-and-drop method but the file select did work.

This was tested Firefox. Not clear when problem first occurred but probably within last 4 weeks. I don’t remember having this problem when I updated the px4flow wiki page a couple of weeks ago.

(Originally raised by Randy)

title: Developer reports unable to log out of live sites
body: As above. Once logged in, attempting to log out results in automatic re-login

title: Fix cause of apache logs related to translations
body:
Error looks something like:

> [Wed Jan 07 22:50:19.087980 2015] [:error] [pid 8556] [client 60.241.80.31:49724] WordPress database error Ta
> ble 'multisite.wp_8_download_monitor_files' doesn't exist for query SELECT \* FROM wp_8_download_monitor_files
>  ORDER BY hits DESC LIMIT 5; made by wp_dashboard, do_meta_boxes, call_user_func, dlm_download_top_widget, W3
> _Db->query, W3_DbCache->query, W3_DbCallUnderlying->query, W3_Db->query, W3_DbProcessor->query, W3_Db->defaul
> t_query, referer: http://ardupilot.com/

The logs can be found using:
grep exist.for.query /var/log/apache2/error.log|cut -d'%' -f2|sort -u|less

Current log list of affected titles:
2.0
2.8
aileron
ailerons
altimeter
and
Antenna
antennatracker
antennatracker-frame-assembly
antennatracker-introduction

calibration
CLI
Command
common
common-3dr-radio-version-2
common-3dr-radio-version-2/feed/rss2/wiki/common-3dr-radio-version-2

title: Broken wiki-style links are shown as normal text
body: The esimplewiki plugin marks up "invalid" wiki-style ([[Title of page]]) links using class="unwiki", but this is not used in the theme to highlight links. CSS should be added to the theme for this to show the links in red.
